page.title: 05Places of worship
page.content: The parish church of Stretton Sugwas is dedicated to St.Mary Magdalene. It was built in l878 to replace the 13th century church near Stretton Court. Much of the new church used materials from the old site, including three Romanesque or Norman arches. Old timber was used to make a higher tower, the vertical black timbers being separated by narrow panels of white-painted infill. This design is peculiar to Herefordshire. Until very recently the parish had its own Rector, but now has to share one with the adjoining parish of Burghill because of the greatly reduced number of active worshippers in the Church of England generally. There are no other places of worship, members of other religious denominations having to travel into Hereford or beyond.
